courses.name: Smoke and Mirrors: An Introduction to Technical Theatre
courses.desc:
This course aims to give students an introduction to the technical processes of theatrical production, including scenery, lighting, sound, multimedia, properties, and stage management. Students will apply their 
new skills to support at least one Glendon theatre production.
Course credit exclusion: GL/DRST 2200 6.00.

courses.name: Performance I
courses.desc: This course acquaints students with key elements of performance through the study of written texts and practical exercises. After introducing major concepts central to all the performing arts, it focuses on fundamentals specific to text-based performance. Course credit exclusion: GL/DRST 2210 3.00.

courses.name: Performance II/Arts de la scène II
courses.desc:
This course pursues at a more advanced level the study of major concepts central to the performing arts, and the practice of performance exercises. It prepares the students to deal with text and acquaints them 
with various performance styles./ Ce cours poursuit à un niveau plus avancé l'étude des concepts fondamentaux des arts de la scène et la pratique d'exercices. Il initie les étudiants au travail sur le texte et à différents styles de jeu théâtral.
PRIOR TO FALL 2014: course credit exclusion: GL/DRST 2215 3.00.

courses.name: Western Drama: Ancient to Modern
courses.desc: This course provides a text-based study of major theatrical achievements from early Greece to the late nineteenth century. This study situates the plays within cultural and historical contexts while focusing on practices of theatrical staging. PRIOR TO FALL 2010: course credit exclusions: GL/EN 2610 3.00, GL/EN 2612 3.00.

courses.name: Individual Studies
courses.desc: Students do independent reading and research together with written assignments under the guidance of a member of the college. All individual studies in drama studies at Glendon are subject to specific regulations which the program will supply on request. (Since there is no assurance that a proposed project will be accepted, students are encouraged to enrol in another course until a decision is made concerning the proposal.)

courses.name: Individual Studies

All individual studies in drama studies at Glendon are subject to specific regulations which the program will supply on request. (Since there is no assurance that a proposed project will be accepted, students are encouraged to enrol in another course until a decision is made concerning the proposal.)

courses.name: La dramaturgie du XVIIe siècle
courses.desc:
Ce cours porte sur le théâtre du « Grand Siècle ». Seront étudiées certaines oeuvres de Corneille, Molière et Racine aussi bien que quelques pièces baroques et les théories de Boileau sur le théâtre. Condition préalable : GL/FRAN 2870 3.00 ou GL/FRLS 2700 3.00 ou permission du département d'études françaises.
Cours incompatible: GL/FRAN 3250 3.00.

courses.name: Reading Shakespeare
courses.desc:
A study of a representative selection of Shakespeare's playtexts, with particular attention to how we produce their meanings.
Course credit exclusions: AP/EN 3535 6.00.

courses.name: Postcolonial Drama in English
courses.desc: This course examines contemporary English-speaking postcolonial drama issuing from one or a combination of the following regions: South and West Africa, Southeast Asia, India, Australia, New Zealand, the Caribbean and Canada.

courses.name: Medieval English Drama
courses.desc: This course studies the early development of English drama from the Biblical cycles of the medieval carft guilds, and the moralities and interludes, through to the humanist drama of the first half of the 16th century.

courses.name: Indigenous Drama and Theatre
courses.desc: A study of the development of Indigenous drama and theatre in Canada, this course examines key performances and dramatic texts, and situates them within their theoretical, historical, and theatrical contexts. It also considers the practical aspects of staging and performance.

courses.name: Le français des stars
courses.desc:
Ce cours a pour objectif de travailler prononciation et élocution par le biais du français oral des milieux littéraire, théâtral/cinématographique et médiatique. Il présente l'évolution de la prononciation et de l'élocution françaises et invite les étudiants à réciter des poèmes, déclamer des tirades et présenter l'actualité. 
Condition préalable : GL/FRAN 2870 3.00 avec un minimum de C ou permission du Département d'études françaises. Remarque : ce cours n'est pas ouvert aux francophones.
Cours incompatible : GL/FRLS 3925 3.00.

courses.name: Approaches to Theatre
courses.desc: This course will introduce students to theatre by the study of theoretical and practical approaches to production. First-term classes and workshops will culminate in a second-term production.

courses.name: The Stage Director's Process/Le processus du metteur en scène
courses.desc:
This course introduces approaches towards directing, with an eye towards the relationship between director and actor. Students acquire skills through hands-on directorial experiences./Ce cours présente diverses approches de la mise en scène et, se concentre sur la relation entre le metteur en scène et l'acteur. L'apprentissage inclut des expériences pratiques.
Prerequisites: At least two of the following: GL/DRCA/DRST 1200 6.00, GL/DRCA/DRST 1210 3.00, GL/DRCA/DRST 1215 3.00, GL/DRCA/DRST 2517 6.00, GL/DRCA/DRST 2615 6.00 or permission of the Department.

courses.name: Current Intercultural Performance Practices
courses.desc: This course offers historical, theoretical and experiential approaches to intercultural, multicultural, Indigenous, and diasporic performance, with an emphasis on contemporary practices. It provides a framework for understanding theatre and performance in relation to cultural specificity, both internationally and in Canada.
